page.title: 01Colliery Communities
page.content: This block contains three villages, {Wingate, Wheatley Hill and Thornley.} These are all mining communities which have relied on mining for employment since the mid-eighteenth century. All three collieries have since closed and the related problems caused by this are constanlty in the minds of the local inhabitants. Consequently, much of the information revolves around the{search for replacement {industries}and the{return of the {surrounding countryside to its former {natural state.} Today there are virtually no visual signs that the mining industry ever existed. The countryside is natural and attractive once again. Inwardly, however, there is still some bitterness and resentment that a state industry should withdraw leaving loyal workers without work.
